value.title: Energy Dept. funded JetCool nets $17M to disrupt chip cooling as AI workloads surge
value.excerpt: JetCool's technology is enabling 30% faster processing while reducing energy consumption by 50% and water usage by 90% over air cooling.

value.title: AI industry set to use as much energy as countries like Sweden or the Netherlands, study finds
value.excerpt: AI comes with a huge carbon footprint and its development could see the industry's energy consumption match levels of an entire country by 2027, a study has found.

value.title: AMD to acquire Nod.ai to boost open source AI software capabilities
value.excerpt: “The acquisition of Nod.ai is expected to significantly enhance our ability to provide AI customers with open software that allows them to easily deploy highly performant AI models tuned for AMD hardware,” Vamsi Boppana, senior vice president of Artificial Intelligence Group at AMD, said in a statement.

value.title: Bank Of America Identifies 6 Global AI Stocks As 'Hidden Gems' With Great Potential
value.excerpt: Bank of America has highlighted five global stocks poised to profit as the application of artificial intelligence (AI) continues to burgeon. The bank projects significant growth potential for “end-device AI,” a deviation from the current server-based systems.

value.excerpt: Qualcomm said its upcoming Snapdragon X chips for PCs will contain the legally contested custom Oryon CPU design, setting the stage for increased rivalry against Intel and AMD.

value.title: Samsung accelerates efforts to lead AI chip market

value.title: US poised to tighten restrictions on chip equipment exports to China
value.excerpt: A rule aimed at restricting exports of U.S. chipmaking equipment to China is in the final stages of review, suggesting the Biden administration is tightening restrictions on Beijing.

value.title: NVIDIA DGX Cloud Gives CSPs And Their Customers Exactly What They Want: Fast AI, Fast

And enterprises love access to state-of-the-art hardware and software in their favorite cloud.

value.title: European Commission to keep track of AI and semiconductor chips
value.excerpt: Sources revealed that on October 3, 2023, European Union officials mentioned that they have identified four areas that need assessment regarding technology risk and risk of technology leakage. The areas are believed to include AI, advanced semiconductor technologies, quantum technologies and biotechnologies.

value.title: Lemurian Labs is building a new compute paradigm to reduce cost of running AI models

value.title: Pixel 8 Pro runs Google’s generative AI models on-device
